meanings.definition: To come to an arrangement or agreement
meanings.sent1: The two friends had to dealign on which movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: They decided to dealign on a meeting time that worked for both of them.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dealign on toppings for the pizza became a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: After much discussion, they were finally able to dealign on a fair price.
meanings.sent5: The team had to dealign on a strategy to win the game.

meanings.definition: To handle or manage a situation
meanings.sent1: She had to dealign with a difficult customer at work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher needed to dealign with a noisy classroom.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to dealign with a sudden shortage of ingredients.
meanings.sent4: He skillfully dealt with the unexpected challenge that came his way.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter had to dealign with a blazing fire in the building.

meanings.sent1: The two companies had to dealign on the terms of the contract.
meanings.sent2: They sat down to dealign the details of the partnership.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had to dealign on who would get the bigger room.
meanings.sent4: Negotiating with the client, she had to dealign on a suitable price.
meanings.sent5: The diplomats met to dealign a peaceful resolution to the conflict.

meanings.definition: To make a deal or transaction
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent helped them dealign on a house purchase.
meanings.sent2: They were able to dealign on a fair trade for the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to dealign on swapping their toys.
meanings.sent4: The businessmen met to dealign a profitable agreement.
meanings.sent5: She successfully dealigned on a new car with the dealership.
